channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Narrow road causes traffic jams every day, 3rd September
item.description:
For years, Seymour Villas has been a hotspot for severe traffic congestion and frequent, aggressive driver altercations. As a lifelong resident of 163 Anerley Road overlooking the junction, I am subjected to daily noise, stress, and episodes of road rage. The problem stems from the road being too narrow for two-way traffic due to resident cars parked on both sides. Despite this, it serves as a popular shortcut for commuters, guaranteeing constant conflict as vehicles attempt to pass in opposite directions, especially during rush hour. The situation has become untenable. Recently, a standoff between two drivers refusing to reverse for each other blocked the road for over 40 minutes. This gridlock trapped dozens of vehicles, and the confrontation escalated with shouting from other drivers and frustrated bystanders until the police arrived to resolve it. While extreme, this incident exemplifies the daily occurrences. These altercations are not just noisy; they are a serious safety concern. I have witnessed drivers being physically threatened, and on one occasion, a driver retrieved a baseball bat to threaten another motorist. Urgent intervention is needed to address this public safety issue. Possible solutions could include implementing a formal Give Way system or restricting parking to one side of the road to allow traffic to flow. I am certain that other local residents would confirm overwhelming support for a permanent solution to this long-standing and dangerous problem.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Seymour Villas, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant fly tipping, 3rd September
item.description:
Is this a designated refused drop off??? Constant fly tipping for months, keep reporting and keeps being marked as resolved - which it isn’t. Please can we get a sign or something to try and stop it?! It’s EVERY day

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stoke Newington Common, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
The drainage gully that is on the pavement outside 2 and 3 Duxberry Close has water sitting in one end (outside 2 Duxberry Close) so the gradient doesn't seem correct, also the drainage hole has leaves in it. Please can this be looked at, and also regular maintenance arranged.

item.title: Laurel overhanging footpath, 3rd September
item.description:
Footpath virtually impassable due to vegetation and have to resort to walking on road. During wet weather, trying to pass results in getting soaked! Property possibly rented or social housing. Shrubs need significant cut back and reduced height to alleviate further obstructions.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 95, Wellington Road, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trees need to be pollarded, 3rd September
item.description:
To whom it may concern, I am writing to kindly request for the council to arrange pollarding of the trees located at 73 whitebeam avenue. The trees have grown significantly and are now posing potential safety risks for the public. Pollarding would help ensure public safety, preserve the health of the trees, and improve the local environment. I would be grateful if this work could be scheduled at the earliest opportunity. One of the trees has recently been cut back on one side but the other two have not been touched at all. They are too tall and especially in windy conditions pose a risk. Thank you for your consideration.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Whitebeam Avenue, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti sprayed on a brick wall opposite number 2 Robsart street. The graffiti is against a long brick wall and can be jet sprayed off., 3rd September
item.description:
Graffiti sprayed along a Brick wall opposite number 2 Robstart Street Brixton SW9.There is a fair amount of graffiti leading from Robstart Street up towards number 10 Thornton street it is very visible. Unfortunately there is more graffiti following up Thornton Street towards Brixton main road. The graffiti has been there a little over a week. Please can it be removed it only encourages more opportunists to spray nearby.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thornton Street, Brixton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Urgent: Growing Chained Homeless Camps and Rubbish on Mare Street, 3rd September
item.description:
I’m concerned about the growing piles of chained carts, trolleys, suitcases, and rubbish from homeless camps on the pedestrian part of Mare St near McDonald’s. It’s unsafe, worsens antisocial behaviour, and ruins the space for everyone. Please take action!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mare Street, Hackney, London

item.title: Propane cylinders incorrectly stored by Equans, 3rd September
item.description:

item.title: Graffiti sprayed on shop shutter on both front and side of premises. Located at 298 Brixton road SW9 6AG., 3rd September
item.description:
I like to report graffiti sprayed against a black shop shutter at 298 Brixton road SW9 6AG. The graffiti is on both the front and side of the premises. The graffiti has been there for over a week. Please can it be painted over. There is more graffiti on the same street which is very visible both on the wall and pavement boxes. If those can be removed too it will be very much appreciated.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thornton Street, Brixton, London
Report on FixMyStreet
